qas.question: What was believed to be one of the Burma reasons for the unrest in 2012 ?

answers.text: many commentators citing the killing of ten Burmese Muslims by ethnic Rakhine

qas.question: How many are believed to have been uprooted by this unrest ?
Who is the president of the BROUK's UK division?
How many people where missing after the 2012 Burma civil unrest ?

context: The immediate cause of the riots is unclear, with <a0_0>many commentators citing the killing of ten Burmese Muslims by ethnic Rakhine<a0_0/> after the rape and murder of a Rakhine woman as the main cause. Whole villages have been "decimated". Over 300 houses and a number of public buildings have been razed. According to <a2_0>Tun Khin<a2_0/>, the president of the Burmese Rohingya Organisation UK (BROUK), as of 28 June 2012, 650 Rohingyas have been killed, <a3_0>1,200 are missing<a3_0/>, and more than 80,000 have been displaced. According to the Myanmar authorities, the violence, between ethnic Rakhine Buddhists and Rohingya Muslims, left 78 people dead, 87 injured, and thousands of homes destroyed. <a1_0>It displaced more than 52,000 people<a1_0/>.
